intro: Didymoplexiella borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean didymoplexiella, is a rare flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with four petals and elliptical leaves. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of dense tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
